729142f-a.title: Richmond: Melvin Avenue - Wild Avenue
729142f-a.text:
Melvin Avenue (right), at the N.E. corner of
Wild Avenue. The building is on the Louis Schmul
property and was, presumable, a dance hall for the
citizenry of Linoleumville.
May 19, 1932
P. L. Sperr
729142f-a.folder: Melvin Avenue & Wild Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729904f-a.title: Richmond: Wild Avenue - Melvin Avenue
729904f-a.text:
Wild Avenue, east side, between Melvin Avenue and
Pearson Street, showing an old house on the Louis Schmul
proDenty. Thus property was deducateu, in Rpril, 1e39, as
Schmul Park, after Louis Schmul donated tne land to the City
of New York to be developed as a public park and children's
playground. For aooitional information see "The New York Times,"
Kpril 21, 1w69.
May 19, 1932
L. Sperr
